definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: In some other minutes the smoke will fall onto the coast of the Arctic ocean.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟后，这片烟雾将会掉落在北冰洋的海岸。

sentences.english: Meteorites are asteroid fragments that fall to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 陨石是掉落地球的小行星残骸。

sentences.english: Some overseer structures that are supposed to drop loot will now do so.
sentences.chinese: 一些监察官舰船已正确掉落战利品。

sentences.english: The contents of my packet settled down in travelling.
sentences.chinese: 旅行的时候我包里的东西掉落到包底了。

sentences.english: House was shaking. Pic fell off bookcase.
sentences.chinese: 房子在摇晃，书架上的画框掉落下来。

sentences.english: Tee-Hee:There are two ways to disable an croc, you know.
sentences.chinese: 知道，有两种举措措施让鳄鱼掉落伤力。

sentences.english: Now the meat is loose like mud and goes apart from bone to fall down.
sentences.chinese: 这时整块肉像松脆的泥块，分崩离柝的掉落在地上。

sentences.english: The coin that clatters in my begging bowl.
sentences.chinese: 是一枚硬币掉落在我行乞的碗里。

sentences.english: The nosegay for lover to dreams appointment fallen off, relating to depravation.
sentences.chinese: 恋人梦见约会时花束掉落，关系恶化。

sentences.english: Will drop one Uruk Lieutenant uniform when slain.
sentences.chinese: 死后会掉落一件强兽人中尉制服。

sentences.english: Feeding on the pieces of food dropped from the elephant's mouth.
sentences.chinese: 因为吃到从大象嘴中掉落的米饭。

sentences.english: There is a saying that every time the sheep bleats, it loses a mouthful of hay.
sentences.chinese: 有句古谚曾说，绵羊每叫一声，它就会掉落一口干草。

sentences.english: While each looks at the other, the ball falls to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 在他们你看我，我看你的时候，球已经掉落地上了。

sentences.english: The BOSS karaoke Zan falling demand analysis and commoner career.
sentences.chinese: 卡拉赞各BOSS掉落及其布衣职业需求分析。

sentences.english: The repetitive problem is that whenever I enter my bedroom something always falls.
sentences.chinese: 持续出现的麻烦是每次我走进卧室，总会有东西掉落。

sentences.english: Big cracks and breakaway pieces are foreboding signs of what's ahead.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的裂缝和掉落的冰团是摆在面前的不祥的征兆。

definition: to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
to drop off/to come off/to lose (hair etc)/to omit (a character when writing)
